23847313.review:
This is a pretty simple game to just pick up and play, and it will probably only eat up about an hour or so of your time.  Your job is simply to heal everyone in the kingdom who has various illnesses and physical ailments.  The chests that you find will increase your hearts (your life force), shooting strength, number of shots fired at once, or the number of flasks you can throw during a single battle.  You'll also earn hearts after each battle.  Your battles consist of dodging enemies and their attacks while you auto-fire at them.  Press your lone action button to throw a flask; it takes some time to adjust to the distance they are thrown, but they are good in some encounters for clearing out multiple enemies.  Gates on the world map block your progress if you either haven't collected a certain key or enough life hearts.  Search everywhere for treasure chests!

For me, the game had sound and slowdown issues.  I received errors with DirectSound initialization, and music rarely ever played.  Also, the game would slow down dramatically during more intense battles, causing my inputs to be eaten and moves or flasks I was trying to execute simply not coming out.  This is my primary gripe; things like this shouldn't happen on a system with a 3.9 GHz hex-core processor with 12 GB of system RAM and a 2 GB video card (Windows 10, by the way).  Still, I was able to play through the entire game and beat it.  The final boss battle is very interesting and a nice test of your skills to that point.  I won't spoil anything, but to me, it's reminiscent of Kefka in [i]Final Fantasy VI[/i].

Aside from the issues I personally experienced, there's not much to keep me from recommending this game.  If you don't have the issues I encountered on your own system, then add another point to this score.

6.5 out of 10

23817506.review:
This is an awesome retro game [b]short (about 1 hour)[/b] though it may be. Feels and sounds like this game came from the NES era which is something I can appreciate. The controls are also very simple. Basically move with directional buttons and you have an action button to talk to people or use vials (bombs) in battle or bring up your stat screen or even to run while holding a direction. You can also use a [b]controller[/b] which is what I did. Remmy (or remedy as reffered to in game) is sent down to hurtland to heal everyone including Prince Hingst. The main objective is to find him and cure him of his own ailments. You must go around the various maps and find people and other creratures to cure. To heal someone in this game you go into a [b]"heal mode" battle[/b] where you face off against various virus creatures. Whichever direction you're looking is where you will shoot your healing powers. To clear the battle you have to destroy all of the viruses on screen. You do have vials to throw which can help with crowd control. It's a lot like a mini [b]pixel bullet hell[/b] game with a bit of [b]rpg elements[/b] thrown in. After my first playthrough I was addicted. I wanted to get a full completion file and played it again. [spoiler]This time I got 101% [/spoiler] Now working toward doing that on the hardest difficulty. 

[b]It's a free game just try it already! Especially if you like a little shmup action. This game is a real gem and I think I've found my next speedrun game.[/b]

By changing the idioms of exploration RPGs and shmups from violence to altruism, it makes a very simple but effective case that kill-or-be-killed needn't be the default assumption of your game world. This little gem would be worth a buy up to $2.99, easily; for free, why not give it a go?

It's a very nice 2 hour game.

...

...

Oh, you mean you want me to write more than this?! Well the graphics look a lot like late '80s EGA-stile, but better done than what was available at the time, and with good reason, since this is the kind of game that would have tanked a computer of that era.

- Yes it's a 1 button game, that looks like it was made for an '80s joystick in mind,
- Yes it looks dated,

But the hardware of that time was a lot less than what is available today. Probably a microwave oven of this time is more powerful than the computers of the '80s.

Yet it still recaptures the kind of gameplay that was available at that time. It has a fun story, hidden bosses, hidden monsters, an '80s "we need to be good" end of a cartoon feel which is both charming and amusing.

Also it's free.

Give it a try, it could be an afternoon well spent.

Забавная несложная (поначалу, и если играть на easy) игра, этакая упрощенная до нельзя Undertale. Сатурнианская принцесса-медсестричка-магичка ищет принца, по пути исцеляя всех и вся с помощью отстрела микробов у них где-то внутри. Стрельба происходит автоматически, можно кидать гранаты, главное уворачиватся от врагов и их пуль, так же используя как прикрытие окружающую среду, которая тоже разрушается. По ходу игры надо собирать сердечки (для переходов в новые зоны), бомбочки, ключи и прочее. Есть секретные проходы и, даже, очень хорошо припрятанный [spoiler]важный сундук, который надо открыть после всех остальных[/spoiler].
 Знание языка особо вроде бы не нужно, но и не помешает, для уяснения тонкостей игры и познания ее сюжета и юмора.

 Отличная около-8-битная музыка и такая же графика. Играть, пожалуй, лучше всего в 3х-кратном окне, примерно по полчаса до еды. Можно и после, главное не вместо.

 Не советую делать настройку д-пад, если он у вас работает, не пытайтесь изменить, так как после этого он у вас нормально может уже и не заработать) вылечивается обратно удалением options.sav в папке игры. (можно заранее сохранить куда-нибудь и тогда поэкспериментировать, если есть такая охота)

 Вообщем, рекомендую, 9 лечилок из 10. даже 10, ведь игра, как ни странно, бесплатная, за что ее авторам отдельный респект.

23517427.review: Princess Remedy is a charming & sweet little bullet-hell-lite-esque game that evokes a rather unique sense of nostalgia while still staying true to its own style. It is a very short game - for a completionist-run you won't really spend more than an hour on it unless you're going for every ending or you're not used to bullet hells, but the experience will still make your day a little lighter. The humour doesn't get old (though it helps the game is too short to run the style of humour into the dirt), and the dialogue is refreshingly lighthearted. Additional pros are that, in the ending (spoilers ahead, obviously), you aren't limited in your marriage choices to just male characters. In fact, you can marry basically anyone. I would have gladly paid £2 for a short & sweet little game like this, so the fact that on top of all these wonderful points the game is FREE? It certainly deserves all my recommendations. Give this game a try, seriously! The charm will lighten your day, even if only for a little while, and if it doesn't? You lose nothing for having given it a shot. Go have some fun and heal some people! :)

23508894.review:
https://youtu.be/EJZL-qjku4A

[h1][b]Geschichte[/b][/h1]
Wir spielen eine Prinzessin von einem Ort der hoch über der Welt des Schmerzes entsand wird, um diese Welt vor dem Schmerz zu heilen. Alles was leidet sollen wir mit unseren Kräften heilen, während wir im laufe der Zeit unsere Kräfte stärken.

[h1][b]Grafik[/b][/h1]
Wir  haben hier eine einfache 2D Grafik, wo wir vereinzelt detailierte Bilder sehen aber überwiegend eine einefach 2D Darstellung haben. Für ein kostenloses  Spiel kann man auch nicht viel erwarten aber vollkommen ausreichend.

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]
Die Steuerung ist entweder mit der Tastatur oder mit dem Controller zu spielen wobei es nicht viel zu beachten gibt bei der Steuerung. Wir laufen umher und finden alles mögliche was nicht normal aussieht und können dies heilen. Sobald wir mit dem heilen anfangen, werden wir in eine kleine Karte teleportiert, wo es je nach Schwerigkeit verschiedene Monsterarten mit verschiedenen Angriffsarten in unterschiedlicher Anzahl gibt. Unsere Aufgabe ist es  alle Monster zu  töten und dann haben wir dieses Objekt geheilt.

[h1][b]Sound[/b][/h1]
Die Musik ist passend zum Grafikstil und versetzt einem etwas in Errinnerung mit anderen Spielen die auch in diesem Grafikstil waren oder die man von Früher kennt.

[h1][b]Wiederspielwert[/b][/h1]
Es gibt 2 Schwerigkeitsgrade die  dadurch etwas Herausforderung bieten. Ansonsten gibt es leider keine Erfolge was man sammeln könnte um dieses Spiel ein 3. oder 4. mal zu spielen.

[h1][b]Herausforderung[/b][/h1]
Der normale Schwerigkeitsgrad ist nicht so schwer  was einem schnell durch  das Spiel  jagdt. Der nächste Schwerigkeitsgrad sorgt für etwas mehr Herausforderung aber die Spielweise selber ist nicht so sehr Herausfordernd wie andere Spiele.

[h1][b]Fazit[/b][/h1]
Wer sich nicht viel um die Grafik kümmert und ein nettes Spiel für Zwischendruch sucht dem kann ich dieses Spiel ans Herz liegen. Es ist schnell durchgespielt und macht auch Spaß wenn man sich darauf einlässt.

23354223.review:
This is one of those games for which I'm EXTREMELY glad to see a sequel coming because Princess Remedy is made of charm. Now, I won't say this game is perfect. It's not especially in depth and the combat system was maybe a little ~too~ simple, but for a game that was put together in four days (for charity, I might add), it's pretty freakin' good.

Basically, imagine if a multi-directional shooter like Berzerk or Robotron 2084 was given an overworld. That's this game in a nutshell. The first thing you're going to notice is that this game looks like something released on the ZX Spectrum or the Amstrad CPC in the 80's, and considering you only have the directional keys and "action button" to work with, that's not a bad description of how it plays. In all honesty, the idea of that had me a bit wary at first, even in spite of the already mostly positive reviews it was getting. Don't get me wrong, I love retro and retro-styled games, but the simplicity of Princess Remedy put me off a little at first.

But of course the game was free, so I figured "why not?"

I'm happy to say that the simplicity ends up working in its favor. While yes, I wish the combat system had a few more options, the game plays very smoothly even with a single button. And the graphics, while basic, are well-crafted and fun to look at (especially the titular character's portrait- she is just TOO cute).

Basically, this is a game that could have gone very wrong, but exceeded my expectations. So I'll be buying the sequel when it comes out, because I'm all for seeing more of Princess Remedy's adventures.

23308853.review:
There's literally no reason to not get this game, it's free. It's also adorable, a fun take on a simplified control scheme (there is an action button and movement keys, that's all you need), and the battle scenes are really enguaging.

Heal the sick by going into a "healing zone" and pelting their problems with pills, a limited number of bombs (flasks), and try not to get hit yourself while auto firing in whatever direction you're facing. It's so simple but the devs did a fantastic job of giving each area variation and each enemy formation is a fresh challenge. Each and every chest has upgrades to make this easier with more powerful pills, more flasks per battle, more health, more recovery, and more shots fired at once.

Plus, the graphics are colorful and nice to look at while making everything as recognizable as it needs to be.
Fully reccomended.

23274471.review: I understand that I have played this for less than half an hour at the time that I am writing this. But, in that 25 minutes of play time that I have sunk into it, I already have plenty of gripes with this game. First off, I am not a fam of the art style. I understand that they were going for something out of the normal pixel graphics indie game loop with something looking commorore/NES-esque graphical style, but it just does not work for me. Second, the difficulty spike in the beginning of the game is too much too fast. It doesn't take long to get used to, but it's so sudden I had a hard time getting used to it. But, with those problems, the game still has an unmatchable charm that is very difficult to find in most games nowadays. The music is some of the best I have heard in a long time, up there with games like Mega Man and NieR in my opinion. The gameplay is very enjoyable, combining a sort of action-rpg and bullet hell style that has plenty of problems, but is still a ton of fun to play with. The humour in this game is done very well, using plenty of references, puns, and portmanteaus to drive home the point that Ludosity wanted to make a funny game without being crude and offensive. Finally, the characters. Play for yourself to see what I mean by that. All in all, Princess Remedy is a fun little game that definitely deserves to be given a try.

Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt, aside from having the cutest little title, is an extremely sweet, short and completely free game where you control a princess from outer space sent down to Earth to make it less of a shit hole. You do this by violently healing everyone (and everything) you come across.

It isn't even an hour long, which isn't necessarily good or bad, but the gameplay is smooth, fun and addicting, and the style and humor of the NPCs is reminiscent of games like Earthbound and Undertale -- a little random, doesn't exactly make sense, but it's oh so endearing.

I'd pay for this, frankly. Sequel also coming!

Wonderfully cute game. Very short; I beat it within two hours. However the length doesn't mean it won't provide a challenge. I definitely reccomend it. 22958565.review:
Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt is one of the nicest little games I've played this year.
As the titular Saturnian Princess, a recent graduate of healing school, you must descend to the tortured Hurtland below in order to heal the land's prince, who has somehow saddled himself with every illness in existence... And maybe fix up the rest of Hurtland along the way. 
Gameplay is very simple, and only directional buttons and an action button are required. You simply enter various towns and caves from the overworld, and talk to sick-looking NPCs. To cure them, you must clear a small top-down shooter minigame, launching bandages at personifications of various ailments. (Unfortunately, you can only fire in the direction you are facing, but I suppose this can be attributed to style.)
Each minigame you clear and person you heal will earn you another hit point, and various other upgrades like shot power and regeneration can be found in chests throughout the world. You'll need them, as the germs and creatures you fight will get progressively stronger. Don't worry, though- If you fail a heal-fight, you can try again with no penalty.
The game has some amusing visuals and a lot of funny dialogue- most of the people you heal are grappling with some sort of silly condition, like a ghost who's scared of himself and a centaur who is worried because he believes he is real. (This is reminiscient of other games from the same folks, such as Ittle Dew- the protagonists of which make a cameo in this game.)
Finally, the heavily retro graphics may look off-putting at first, but I got used to them quickly and soon enjoyed the old-fashioned feel. I also found them to be much more colorful and identifiable than I was expecting- definitely more so than the majority of the old stuff they take inspiration from. 
Overall, Princess Remedy is a quick jaunt that is absolutely worth an hour or so of your time. My only complaint is that it's free-to-play, so I can't have it permanently associated with my account.

A better version of a Games against Ebola game jam. Princess Remedy was my favorite game of the jam, it has some cameos from ludoverse characters and some silly dialoge. It is short, Having beaten it like 2-3 times prior it took me about 1hr to 101% it on normal (there are 2 hard difficultes now). 3 save is a nice touch to. I recommend talking to everyone in the first area to get the controls down. Word of advice, after you beat the boss the game goes into that marry mode people were talking about, all cured NPCs will just ask if you want to marry them (and ever single one has a little bit of added flavor text for the ending) so if you want to hear what a cured or health character says be sure to talk to them before that final boss battle.

All and all this is basically a Quality of Life update to a fun little 3-day game jam game. If you take it slow and talk to people you will likely get maybe around 3 hours. For free it is a good way to kill some time on a lazy weekend afternoon. This game gets my recommendation as worth your time.

Of all the games that could've costed something, this one should've costed something the most.

Despite the developer's self-imposed limitations on graphics and audio, the visuals are still appealing and the music is pleasant to listen to. It has a charming and quirky dialogue and story. It has astonishingly simple controls and gamepad support, with anything besides movement buttons being all the same action button. -Cute story

Cons:
-Enemies have an extremely wide range of movement compared to the player (player moves and fires in 4 directions, can only fire forward; enemies can move 4 directions, fire in 8, and shots aren't tied to their direction of movement)

22656745.review:
The game is free, so it's nearly impossible to say it's not worth playing at the price point, however  there is some garbage unloaded onto steam for free that is an utter waste of time. Gladly, this game is not such a title.

You are: A Princess whose primary role is to heal your kingdom and those in, and beyond it.

The game is an anti-combat RPG, much like the astoundingly popular Undertale.
Your encounters consist of firing healing bandages at 'enemies' (and I use that word loosely) that attack randomly, out of fear and pain. 

Pros:
Good 8-bit styled game reminiscent of 80's and classic arcades
Chiptune soundtrack is great
Controller support is offered.

Cons:
EVERY encounter is pretty much mandatory to progress, locked doors and enemy scaling stop progression until you've tackled every encounter/level that the dev has programmed for you.
It is bare bones, under developed, but for a free game, what do you really expect?
Issues with glitches that (as of posting this review, MONTHS after the title launch) still haven't, apparently never will be fixed, including running app through steam glitches after you exit game.
Mediocre story.

Final Verdict: 7/10 
Gets a passing grade among free games for being entertaining enough, but falls short because of various coding glitches that are an inconvenience to players.

World of Hurt is a delightfully simple game. It isn't very substantial, at a scant 30-45 minutes long, but it takes a bit of finesse and exploration to find everything that you can, and while it isnt extremely chalenging, it grows some fangs towards the later stages of the game, particulalry if you do nothing but barrel through the adventure as fast as possible and don't take your time to find the more hidden goodies.

While not every bit of dailouge is written the best, and some of its characters might have some... questionable motives, its all in good fun. If anything, this only adds to the childlike innocence and lighthearted tone. I also have to make special mention that this game was made for a chairity event. While I don't quite think the game exactly succeeds in being an impactful message for anyone who's lives may have been effected by travesty, the effort is still there and I always will apreciate people wanting to show thier support for others.

It's not particularly meaningfull, but its a charming little adventure that put a smile on my face. If nothing else, it's a fun, bite sized little distraction that is free to try out.

22195991.review:
The next time you have thirty minutes to spare, play [i]Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt[/i]. I didn't have any idea what to expect when I started it up, but I was instantly won over by its charming sense of humor. The game itself isn't bad either. It's designed very much in the spirit of old Spectrum computer games, but it has enough modern sensibilities to appeal to all kinds of gamers.

It'd be enough to simply have a game, where you blast away the pain troubling the inhabitants of Hurtland, but PRIAWOH goes the extra mile by having proper mechanics. Yep, the developer actually cared enough about their free game to have a proper hit-box for the heroine, so that she doesn't take a bunch of damage, just by kinda sorta brushing up against an enemy. A lot of games that cost money, and require way more of our limited time, don't even get this most important aspect right.

When the game is over, you get to decide who Princess Remedy marries. There are over 60 possible candidates, and they all have an amusing comment at the end. Sometimes it's the little touches that matter most, They remind me that buried deep under miles of ocean, rocks, and lava; I have something that could pass for a heart.

I guess the only replay-value is in trying to beat your best time, but it's no big deal. This is a game you play through once and retain nothing but pleasant memories about it. Maybe you'll tell your friends about it and share the love.

21727746.review:
Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt est un jeu hybride entre le jeu d'aventure-action à la Zelda et le shoot them up. Vous guidez votre petite infirmière-doctoresse (?) dans l'univers où elle soigne ses patients en se battant contre les maladies et autre microbes dans des scènes d'action bien remplies, puis vous retournez à votre exploration. Les passages secrets sont nombreux et amusants à trouver. Vous récoltez lors des combats ou dans des coffres des coeurs qui vous servent à la fois de vie et de prérequis pour ouvrir certaines portes de zones dans la grande carte. Esthétiquement, le jeu est à l'image de ce qui se faisait sur ZX Spectrum avec des personnages monochromes en gros pixels et une musique en chiptune. Tout est fait aux petits oignons avec beaucoup d'amour par un développeur indépendant seul. On enchaîne les combats et l'exploration en se disant toujours : "Allez, encore un peu", et le temps file. On rencontre des personnages amusants et on accumule la puissance (on arrive à lancer plusieurs seringues à la fois à la vitesse de l'éclair). Bref, un jeu très amusant à jouer, à l'esthétique qui stimule l'imagination comme un livre pour enfant, qui vaudrait facilement 5 ou 6 euros s'il était vendu, mais non : il est gratuit. Bref, une perle indé à découvrir et savourer.

[b]Les plus[/b]
[list]
    [*]l'esthétique à la Spectrum, y compris la musique
    [*]la jouabilité bien étudiée avec une difficulté progressive
    [*]les passages secrets
    [*]les dialogues amusants
	[*]la sauvegarde n'importe quand
	
[/list]

[b]Les moins[/b]
[list]
    [*]Un peu court (parce que comme c'est bon, on en voudrait plus)
    [*]On aimerait plus d'interaction dans les dialogues
    [*]Pas de français (mais si on me laisse le traduire...)
[/list]

[b]Verdict :[/b] un très bon jeu, cohérent dans sa réalisation et amusant à jouer en soi, avec un univers original, un peu humour, et une esthétique qui stimule l'imagination : j'adhère. (Si vous voulez soutenir le développeur, vous pouvez lui faire un don sur son site : http://www.remar.se/daniel/donate.php )

21711866.review: its fun if you know what you gunna do its not take long time to understand it to!

21705799.review:
A gleam of monomaniacal determination in her eye, the zaftig Princess Remedy descends upon Hurtland to deliver its denizens from their various ills.  Delving with mad joy into the pain-filled microcosmos of each, she pounds their sicknesses (everything from broken-heartedness to death to not enough spider legs) into submission with a never-ending barrage of divine pharmaceuticals -- the speed at which she nimbly flits about these painscapes proving to every awestruck eye that those pleasantly plump thighs house thews of spring steel.  One is struck with an even deeper admiration for Princess Remedy when, quest completed, she stands revealed to all as a pansexual; what singularity of purpose must have driven her onward when every man, woman, centaur, zombie, rock and tree beckoned her ever-burning loins to amorous dalliance!

Why is this game free?  I'm not the only gamer who would have gladly paid for admission into this world so deftly wired-together from the phosphorescent bones ransacked from a ZX Spectrum graveyard.  I demand that Ludosity provide me a sequel, and have the decency to ask me money for it this time!

21624664.review:
Princess Remedy ist KULT. Wie verzweifelt ich damals als Kind vor dem Nintendo (NES) saß ... die meisten Titel waren unbarmherzig und hart wie Dinosaurierkot. Was hätte ich mir früher ein Spiel gewünscht wie dieses! So genial simpel und zugänglich. So witzig und motivierend. Wir spielen eine Heilerin, welche gerade ihre Ausbildung abschließen durfte und nun zu einer wichtigen Mission aufbrechen muss: Hurtland leidet und selbst der Prinz ist krank! Also ziehen wir los, sprechen mit putzigen NPCs, welche uns ihre skurillen Leiden schildern ... und dann geht es in den "Kampf": Remedy wechselt in eine Art Shooter-Modus, der an Space Invaders erinnert - dabei schießt sie automatisch Heil-Salven auf Bazillen, gebrochene Herzen und Depressionsgeister. Das einzige, was wir tun müssen = ausweichen und gut positionieren. Dabei ist das Movement so unglaublich smooth und befriedend ... die Gegner so fair und gut balanciert ... dass es süchtig macht. 

Unfassbar ... man könnte fast glauben, die Macher vom alten Super Mario Bros. zaubern zu sehen. Princess Remedy wirkt unheimlich professionell ... selten ein so rundes Spielerlebnis gehabt. Hier stimmt einfach alles. Dazu noch diese kurzen, knackigen Dialoge voller Charme und Witz und der absolut erstklassige Soundtrack (kann locker mit Klassikern der alten Zeit konkurrieren ... der erste Track schenkte mir einen sofortigen Ohrwurm). Wer ein leichtherziges Retro-Spielchen zocken will kommt hier kaum dran vorbei.

Völlig unverständlich, dass es umsonst ist. Wie viel Geld steckte ich schon in Ramsch? Und ausgerechnet dieser Juwel kommt kostenfrei daher? Ich fühle mich schlecht. Wann gibt es Princess Remedy-Shirts, damit ich meine Schuld begleichen kann?

21524425.review: Отличная маленькая (1 прохождение - около часа) бесплатная экшн-рпг от создателей Ittle Dew. Мы играем за сатурнийскую принцессу, которую отправляют в страну Болезнию излечить местного принца. Перемещаемся мы по 2D карте в духе jRPG. По пути придётся раскачаться, ведь локации разделены барьерами "здоровья". Его мы добываем, излечивая местных жителей. Сам процесс излечения - это быстрые бои на ограниченных аренах а-ля The Binding of Isaac. Бои действительно интересные и, на соответствующей сложности, требущие определённой сноровки. Весь сюжет я описал выше, однако все 64 местных NPC уникальны и радуют своими короткими диалогами. В целом, игра оставляет ощущение тепла и уюта. Этот отзыв я пишу, улыбаясь как идиот. Прекрасный образчик того, что можно сотворить, пользуясь только базовыми геймплейными приёмами. Конечно, тут вырвиглазная пиксельная графика с разрешением 160*140, но про неё забываешь после первого же боя. Крайне рекомедную!

Un bon jeu d'action aventure, avec un petit côté RPG,
et qui dispose d'un certain charme grâce à son style rétro / pixel-art.

Les musiques sont entrainantes, les effets sonores minimalistes.
Il n'y a qu'un seul bouton à employer pour les actions et l'accès à l'inventaire,
donc interface très simple.  Beaucoup de passages secrets à trouver.

Il se termine très rapidement, (comptez environ 2 heure et demi pour en voir la fin),
et dispose de 66 fins différentes en fonction du personnage avec qui vous voulez marier l'héroïne.

Je recommande ce jeu, qui conviendra aux enfants comme aux adultes,
et à toute personne qui n'a pas le temps de se lancer dans de longues parties, ou nostalgique des jeux d'antan.

Idéal pour une machine modeste, moins de 100 mo à l'installation, et peu de ressources nécessaires.

21167880.review:
Un juego simple, lindo y tierno ♥.
Tiene ese estilo retro de videojuegos de los 80-90, con gráficos similares a los de ZX Spectrum con sonido de NES/Gameboy, que por cierto tiene unas melodias muy pegadizas.
Como ya lo sugiere el titulo. controlaremos a una princesa llamada Remedy, que se sumerge a explorar un mundo de dolor y se encargará de curar la enfermedad/desgracia de personas/objetos que se le crucen, para así recolectar corazones que desbloquearan otras zonas.
Tiene elementos de RPG que recuerdan a Zelda, y cuando entramos en el proceso de "curacion" comienza un mini-juego al estilo shoot 'em up, que obviamente irá aumentando la dificultad conforme progresemos.
¿Y que es lo mejor de todo? Que es free to play, y realmente hubiera querido pagarlo al menos unos centavos.
10/10.

21067188.review:
Well, I feel like if I gave this game a negative review, I'd be a massive d***, since it was made for the purpose of raising money to fight Ebola. But, at least the game is actually good, so it makes giving it a thumbs up easy for me.

Princess Remedy followed Princess Remedy as she goes to Hurtland and heals everyone living in it. The story is pretty repetitive, as you just walk around, talk to a monster, fight the virus, then talk to them again. There are plenty of exploration options though, as there are some pretty decently-laid secrets (but some are just flat-out obvious). The gameplay is honestly what kept me playing for so long. It's basically like the fight against Mettaton in Undertale, where in you dodge random sh**, while shooting said sh**. It does start out simple, but as you continue the viruses you fight get harder and harder... except for the boss. He was surpsingly easy. Really, really easy. But the gameplay is still enjoyable. For a game made by so few people, it sounds well and looks fine (almost like Link's Awakening if it were made for Atari).

Again, the graphics aren't perfect. There's very little actual animation in the world of Hurtland, the process of talking to people to find out a punch line after beating their virus gets old after a while. But the exploration and combat are incredibly satisfying to fully delve into. Princess Remedy isn't perfect, but it is fun and it's an enjoyable way to kill an hour or so.

20745803.review:
Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt is short but sweet game, About the titular character helping heal people around the 'World of Hurt'.

The game's focus on simple pixel art and gameplay mechcanics seem to closely follow the aesthetics of the games from the Commodore 64 system.

Gameplay consists of walking around the game's overworld, picking up power-ups and attending to hurt characters. To heal hurt characters, the game uses a simple Shoot 'em Up gamplay where you attempt to shoot down enemies sickness within the characters in a small area (with or without obstacles in them) and trying avoid shoots fired at you. 

My only complain about the game is that action/run button in the overworld is tied to opening the menu, so I oftenly found myself opening the menu by mistake trying to run or interact with something. But it's only a minor gripe and nothing game breaking. 

While not a very long game. Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt is a fun little game with a very pleasing retro art style and gameplay that, for an hour or two, is a fun little time-waster and definitely worth playing.

20735947.review:
Saved the king from his sadness. Allowed me to marry any of the people I've helped during my quest. Married a rose and made him get off his royal throne.

10 / 10

[Review]

Something about the graphics style and music made me nostalgic about my childhood. Gave the game a shot and figured out all there is to the game in just a few minutes. Your task is to heal the king from his sadness, however on your way you encounter lots of people / otherwise that need helping - with sometimes funny comments. Once you choose to help you end up in a rather small environment with your character shooting "vitality" towards all the nasty enemies. 

Think of it as Binding of Isaac without having to fire, and without the ability to aim where you shoot. And that last is the part that didn't quite appeal to me at first. I got quite used to running around and simultaneously shoot in different directions altogether, that it felt quite frustrating at first. However ignoring this, it allowed me to enjoy the rest of the otherwise short game.

Considering it's cheap price tag - erhh, free I definitely recommend this game. Would have even bought it!

TL;DR - Install it, play it for five minutes. If you like it, keep going through the journey - there isn't much else to it, and it's quite short anyway - if you didn't like the first few minutes then don't bother going through with it. I guess it's either a hit or miss, however I found it really entertaining.

20696325.review:
What a wonderful game! For a game made in a game jam (and then edited some afterwards) this is much more in-depth than I expected! True, the game only takes around an hour to complete, but then there's higher difficulties and the multitude of endings possible (each one is only different by like two sentences but still) and plenty of secrets. I only beat it once at time of writing but I plan on trying the other diffitulties and getting 100%, as I only got 97%.

The gameplay is fairly simple: heal people. You talk to them to see their problem(s) and shoot at them with your healing abilities in a 2D shooter/bullet hell format. It's kind of weird due to the fact that you always shoot in the direction you're facing and you can't change it, but I think it adds to the difficulty. Speaking of, this game's difficulty is strangely up-and-down. For the first couple of areas I was breezing through them like a Nascar driver on speed, but suddenly I had to try some healing again and again because of how much the difficulty increased suddenly. Then a bit later, it became easy street again. Then hard. It's all over the place, but it's not bad since losses don't have penalties. 

The story is simple: heal everybody, and heal the Prince! There's not much of a story, but there doesn't need to be. Older games that this is mimicing generally had about this much of a story, if not less, so it emulates it well. All of the characters you speak to have some really funny lines, and I feel like the comedy was done well. Whenever I think "that joke has kind of become slightly overused," the joke ends and another begins. That's key to good comedy. 

Get the game. It's 10mb, free, and fun. The only reason you wouldn't get this game is if you prefer story to gameplay or graphics to fun. I honestly feel like playing it for free was a steal, and I should have paid for this. Could there at least be a little DLC that's like $1 that includes artwork and a thank you note? I'd pay for it, even if it was more than $1. Would you believe me if I said it was made by (I think) 4 people! Crazy!

(rant about how I like the graphics)
I hear my friends sometimes complain about the graphics of older games with one phrase sticking out to me: "it looks like it was made in the 70s," (what someone actually said about Fallout 3). This game actually looks like it was made in the 70s, but that doesn't hinder the game at all. It probably gives it a cute charm. Well that and it's made to look cute, but ya know.

20690300.review:
「棺にはまって出れなくなっちゃった助けて・・・」

Ludocityが送る8BITレトロアクションADV、開発はMURIでおなじみのRemar Games。
治療学校を卒業したばっかりの土星の女王様のRemedyがHurtLandの病気の住民を救うべく地上に降り立つのだが・・・
そこはLudocityである、序盤は確かに病気だったり熱で倒れてたりするが、話を進めていくと突っ込みたくなるような事で病気になっていたりするし、え？治療対象なの？みたいな物も出てくる。
冒頭の文章は唐突にフィールドにそびえ立つピラミッドの主のセリフである。しかし、「会話のセンスが無いんだ」と言ってしおれている花であったり、岩に囲まれているばっかりに自分が岩だと思い込んでいる少女だったりと挙げればバリエーションに暇がない。

病気の治療と軽く書いたが、治療行為自体は益体もないことを言えば弾幕シューティングである。
ショットは自動だがボムは自分で発動させる必要がある（回数は一回ごとに回復するので一回ごとに発動させてしまっても問題ない）
治療を行えばハートが手に入り、一定の数を集めると次フィールドにどんどん進めるようになる。
街中にも宝箱の中にハートであったり追加のボムであったりと散らかっているので回収を行うと道中はどんどん楽に。

ゲーム自体は無料で内容もそこまで充実しているわけではないが、クオリティと出来自体はロープライスのどうにもならないゲームと比較してしまえば圧倒的に上である。
隠しエンド、隠しアイテム、ジョークやLudocity節をそこらじゅうで感じるマップチップであったりと10ドルでも私は普通に買ってしまっただろう。
なお、とあるルートで現れるボスと思われる部分が某最終幻想の6のラスボスの文章含めてパロディで思いっきり笑わせてもらったのは強調して記述しておきたい。

欠点としてはスクリーンショットがまともに撮れないことである。
MURIもそうだったのだがこればっかりは仕方ないのかもしれない。

Prepare to immerse yourself in this nostalgic game featuring great music and gameplay. You explore a world in a 3rd person view similar to Breath Of Fire and Pokemon; in which you open chests to obtain objects that help advance your stats, and initiating "battles" passively when you encounter a sick NPC.The battles are known as "Healing mode" in which you face off enemy viruses by controlling the direction your princess moves and also where she fires "medicine". Another "weapon" you have are flasks which can be thrown as grenades. Enemies range from non-moving patches to gliding ghosts that shoot stuff at you, trying to cut down your health bar. In later levels, the amount of enemy fire thrown your way could easily pass for a bullet- hell game. 
The dialogue is hillarious with NPCs giving various funny reasons for their sicknesses and the ending offers many, many possibilities.
Totally would reccommend. Has great playback value too, really suprised that it's free.
It's short, and I was able to finish it with a 100% completion rate in around 50 minutes.

20630894.review:
It’s an amazing amusing little game with somewhat charming and nostalgic graphics and music. It is crime that this game is free — I want to buy it.

You can call this game “one-stick healer”: you play as a princess wandering through the little world populated only with ill creatures. And you are healing them with magic in an one-stick shooter sequences. It’s very short but nice, charming and a little nostalgic experience. Hell, I have spent more time writing this review than clearing the game (~1.0 hour), and you've probably spent more time reading reviews, when you can just play the damn game instead (it free).

Gameplay: You wander around a small world, open chests and heal different characters. Healing is simple: after a small dialog with an ill NPC, you will appear in the arena with enemies and obstacles. Objectives: do not die, dodge bullets and shoot every enemy. During healing sequences the princess is always shooting where she is directed at, making it a "one stick shooter". It's a little tricky and you should always keep it in mind. When everything (except you) is dead, NPC is healed. And after you defeated the final boss you can marry them.

Story: go to the Hurtland, practice your healing skills and find yourself a husband (or wife).

Character: In the end, you can marry every-bloody-thing and get an exclusive ending for it. Which is lovely.


P.S. For more awesome hidden gems, follow the steam [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10722089/]CRIMINALLY Low Sales[/url] curator.

- it's full of charm and humor ( the ending can become the funniest/nonsensical in the history of video games)

Cons: ( I am scratching the bottom of the barrel here XD)

So is it worth your time? I would answer absolutely even if your not a fan of retro or shoot them up give it a try, it as enough charm and humor to carry you through it's one hour content. According to me it would still be worth it even if it had a 1 euro/dollards price tag.

Удивительно, как при графическом стиле ZX-Spectrum авторы смогли нарисовать таких симпатичных существ. Принцесса Рэмеди, тоже прикольно нарисованная, ходит по деревням и ЛЕЧИТ всяких паучков, чертят, ангелочков и просто сельчан, а ещё цветочки и... кхм, назовём их слизняками :) Когда они больные, они такие грустные, а когда здоровые - такие радостные, так и излучают счастье. Главное, художник какой-то парой пикселей смог это передать, талант, в общем! :D Лечение сделано в виде боёв со всякими рандомными существами - шарики, квадратики, пиксельные приведения, в общем, всё в стиле вечно молодого домашнего компьютера 82 года выпуска :) И хорошо, что именно "в стиле", потому что если бы эта игра по-настоящему была бы создана для Спекки, не звучала бы такая прикольная музычка (либо звучала бы, но не во время игры), да и картинка двигалась бы не так плавно. Но всё равно на машине времени в прошлое слетать удалось, огромное спасибо за эту более чем прикольную игру!

P.S.: Прошёл чуть меньше, чем за час, но для такой маленькой игры это идеальное время (битвы и открывания сундуков не успели надоесть). А после победы над прикольным боссом дали выбор, за кого выйти замуж XD

20511768.review: Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt è un bullet hell shooter con un solo stick sviluppato da Ludosity durante una gamejam di beneficenza svoltasi nel 2014 e supportata da Humble Bundle (Games Against Ebola). Non sono esattamente la persona più adatta per recensire questo gioco: è infatti il secondo del genere che completo dopo Sin and Punishment: Successor of the Skies per Wii, e non mi sono mai definito particolarmente abile nel campo. Inoltre non conoscevo affatto Ludosity, ma dopo questa breve esperienza devo dire che mi è venuta voglia di provare in futuro qualcos'altro di questo sviluppatore: cosa che già di per sé è un risultato positivo. Non avendo capito molto bene fino in fondo il genere del gioco prima di iniziarlo (la grafica mi sapeva più di action adventure) ho settato la difficoltà a "hard", e questo ha più o meno raddoppiato il tempo che ho impiegato a finirlo rispetto alla media. In ogni caso devo dire che la scala di apprendimento è strutturata benissimo anche per un principiante assoluto come me, e le difficoltà che si affrontano nelle parti finali risultano accattivanti ma mai frustranti. Il level design delle sessioni di bullet hell vero e proprio non è mai ripetitivo e presenta sia variazioni sul tema della disposizione delle coperture e dei nemici, sia una vera e propria vasta gamma di avversari con abilità peculiari e diversi parametri di difesa/attacco. Ma non si può negare che il vero fascino di Princess Remedy sia nell'immaginario e nelle logiche che reggono la sua particolare ambientazione. In particolar modo non mi capacito di come questo gioco sia potuto essere concepito in una campagna dedicata a quella che per un certo periodo di tempo era sotto gli occhi di tutti i media considerata come LA Malattia per eccellenza (l'ebola). PR è infatti di un irriverente qualunquismo, in cui il concetto di "cura" che la principessa saturniana deve applicare ai "malati" di Hurtland è così lato da far volutamente perdere i confini della patologia vera e propria, che si va a mescolare con ironia alla paturnia del momento. Raramente si incontreranno dei "malati" veri e propri, e l'effetto comico è assicurato leggendo i commenti dei png accasciati nella più completa costernazione: sarà possibile curare una bambina depressa per avere solo cinque anni facendola crescere di un anno, una ragazza annoiata facendole vedere il metodo di cura, una sola con il potere dell'amicizia (?), una persona con tutti i difetti del mondo facendola diventare perfetta, un boss di un dungeon sconfitto da eroi per permettergli di conquistare il mondo, e così via. Senza considerare che i pazienti spesso saranno fiori, animali, o gli stessi morti, insomma: non esattamente malattie infettive, epidemie o ferite di guerra. Il finale (spoiler) a questo proposito è veramente pazzesco, con una rappresentazione mastodontica dell'assommarsi di più mali nel Principe Hingst, che ha come capo una constatazione esistenziale: possono le emozioni negative essere curate? Non sono esse dei sentori che ci garantiscono che siamo vivi? A queste domande puramente legittime il gioco mostra senza troppe storie il dito medio, con la morale che se qualcosa può far star male in generale può anche essere distrutta, importante o meno che sia. La scelta finale che ha colpito molti, quella del matrimonio, è soltanto un'estensione accessoria di questo modo propagandato di vedere la realtà, in cui se qualcosa si determina in una certa maniera (in questo caso, se provoca amore), va affrontata con una modalità indipendente dalla configurazione della cosa in sé. In poche parole, come un dente cariato va curato come il disagio di avere un brutto nome, se amo un cane lo devo sposare come se amassi una donna. Ovviamente Ludosity gioca sull'effetto nonsense e non è necessario esprimere un parere sul messaggio, ma, ripeto, il particolare contesto in cui questo gioco è stato creato rende il tutto particolarmente straniante e, in un certo senso, unico. Assolutamente da provare.

Simple top-down game that is a mix of exploration and bullet-hell. Can be completed in about 1 hour, and is quite enjoyable.

Graphics are extremely simplistic by design, making the game look like it is from ZX Spectrum.

The gameplay works like this: You explore the area, talk to people, and "cure" their illness through a simple (but sometimes challenging) bullet-hell mini-game. And you open chests and get upgrades to your bullets. Rinse, repeat, until you get to the boss and to the ending.

20461697.review:
Honestly, I downloaded the game because it reminded me of the old school gameboy games from it's video. (I have a thing for anything with a retro vibe.) I am not disappointed at all with the game.

At first, the game does seem a bit repeatitive. Basically, you've been sent down to hurtland to heal people and objects, then you hve to save your friend. First, you're thinking okay this has been done a thousands times. You start playing and then you say this game is rather easy. As you keep playing the levels get harder. When I say the levels get harder; I mean you may find some frustration with the difficulty. If playing on Normal the hard levels are hard, I can only imagine playing those same levels on Hard and Master; would be insane. 

The controls using the keyboard are pretty simple. Your traditonal arrows keys and your action button which is enter, shift, control and a few other keys that I can't remember because it's simpler to use the enter key.

I haven't tried this using a controller yet. When I do try it I will come back and update my review. I use a XBOX One Controller so as soon as I play it I will let you all know how it runs.

I only had one issue with the game where I save and exited the game and then came back to play about 20 minutes later and it made me replay from the beginning. I tried it again the next morning because if I can't save my progress I wasn't going to replay it again for a third time from the beginning. The second time it saved. This may not have been an issue for everyone else, but it was an issue for me.

 Just in case you're hit with this issue I had making you restart from the beginning:
* I had about 40 hearts when it accepted my save this time around.
* There is also the chance that I started a new game and saved over my old one by mistake too, but since I'm not 100% sure, just thought I'd leave that tad bit of information.

Overall, this game with a retro vibe is for all types of gamers who are looking for a casual game. If you need to take a break from a hardcore game you're playing this is a really good alternative to free your mind and is great for casual gamers as well.

The game is free but I would have gladly paid a few bucks for it as well.

基本上对于这种画面的游戏而言最大的吸引力就是免费了，毕竟不要钱，游戏容量也小，不好玩删掉就行了，抱着这样的心态来尝试这款游戏，结果发现好像跟想象的不一样。
游戏的开始给人一种传统RPG的感觉，剧情也没有怎么认真的去看，结果却发现游戏的目标非常的简单，收集❤，然后开启新的道路，就是这样不断的寻找这个道具。
游戏的战斗系统是STG那样的，到后面还有些难度，整个场景充满了弹幕，原本以为这类游戏应该是回合制战斗的，结果给我出乎意料。
游戏有趣的地方是收集❤的关卡设计，很多看得见却拿不到的宝箱，比如有需要通过走到屏幕外面才可以寻找的宝箱，需要穿过障碍物的宝箱等。
总之推荐各位前来试试，是个有新意的游戏！

20425430.review:
I don't know how this managed to slip under my radar until just now but I can't believe I had never heard of this game before.

First off, it's free so you'd only lose an hour of time playing (took me almost an hour to finish but I missed maybe 2 power ups).
Secondly, I'm not entirely sure how to describe the gameplay other than you walk around a world map/towns/locations and after you talk to people you go into a "heal mode" of sorts where you move Princess Remedy around a black screen with enemies and you shoot at them until they all die, thus healing a person.

Think something like Robotron or another twinstick shooter. The main difference between this and those other games is that your shots fire automatically and if you press the action button you fling a flask that has a blast radius and can either take out obstacles in fights or deal significant damage to enemies. The further you go, the more the enemies begin to fire shots like you're in a bullet hell shooter but it's not difficult to avoid enemy fire.

The only thing I could think of that would improve the game is if there were a strife button/option since you only move in the direction you press and it would make taking out enemies easier.

This game definitely deserves to be paid for instead of being free. I would gladly pay to own this game if I could.

It's short, it's sweet, it's free, definitely worth checking out, it's "Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt".

Does anyone else but me feel guilty for not having to pay for this game?

Anyways, it's been a long long time since I've picked up a Gameboy, but not just any Gameboy; I mean my Gameboy. Around that time- you know it was a luxury. At first it was four batteries- then they upgraded the hardware and downsized to about two AAs. Even then it was pretty much a luxury to get to enjoy something that could grab your attention for hours. Something worth spending so much time on just because it made you feel good. This is what that game reminded me of. Being young, being easily entertained by pixel graphics and a soundtrack that is just so simple but so amazing. 

I can't even begin to tell you how sad I feel that I finished the game in less than an hour but still revisited some places to try to 101% it. Since I haven't been able to yet- I'm just going to keep on playing.

It's a free helping of nostalgia. I strongly recommend this game.

20385734.review:
由开发了Ittle Dew的Ludosity制作，有趣的小品作！

玩家扮演土星公主Remedy，为了治愈Hingst王子的疾病而在Hurtland展开了修行之旅。剧情沿袭了Ludosity一贯的作风，轻松愉快，NPC都是逗比，好不容易把他们治好马上又去作死。游戏最后会给玩家一个与任意NPC结婚的机会，与不同NPC结婚结局对话也会略微不同。结婚的对象有许多非常奇葩的选项，你可以与花结婚，与史莱姆结婚，甚至可以选择和Remedy的母亲土星女王结婚www同时本作也跟Ittle Dew一样，加入了大量对于Ludosity之前出品的游戏及其他游戏的捏他，比如招牌吉祥物Apathetic Frog，比如Ittle Dew主角二人组，另外最终Boss绝赞好评！

除去与各种NPC的神奇交互外，本作另一个重要部分就是战斗了。当玩家选择治愈NPC后便会进入治愈空间与病魔战斗！战斗方式为俯视视角的ARPG，不过玩家只能控制自己的移动方向及使用确认键扔[strike]手雷[/strike]药剂，Remedy会自行向面向的方向发射[strike]子弹[/strike]药丸。简单明快，不过由于射击方向固定加上后期较高的敌人密度，导致某些关卡略恼火。除去战斗操作，游戏的所有操作都集中在确认键上，由于没有取消键，导致退出菜单不太方便。这种略神奇的操作大概是本作唯一的减分点了。

本作虽然流程略短，100%也只需要一小时不到，不过内容还是很丰富的，有数个隐藏地点供玩家探索，作为免费游戏可谓良心，推荐一试。
顺便，期待Ittle Dew 2！

Pros:
-Quirky and cute with some oddball characters along the way.
-The gameplay evolves enough that it's challenging but not outright impossible.
-Reminds me of shining force a little bit.
-Well varied array of enemies.
-Well hidden areas, giving a genuine throwback to retro game design.

Cons:
-Soundtrack can be grating at times, although some tracks are catchy, and the gaps when looping are a bit jarring.
-A multi-use control is a bit odd, not sure if this is the same with controller.
-Graphics alias when on fullscreen mode.
-Since it's free-to-play, no trading cards.


To sum up, I would definitely pay for this if it were possible. Go! Don't be an apathetic frog and go and download it!

20363227.review:
[b]Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt [/b] é um jogo indie com gráficos bem retrôs 8bits do gênero Action/RPG/Adventure. 

Você toma controle da Princessa Remédio, uma aluna recém-formada em uma Academia onde as garotas aprendem curar, e que tem a missão de curar o Príncipe que está muito doente assim como todo o seu reino.

A jogabilidade é separada por 2 partes: A primeira quando você anda normalmente pelo mapa, um RPG, obtendo elementos para melhorar sua personagem. Assim ao encontrar alguém doente, você troca para um sistema de shooter~action (semelhante a The Binding of Isaac) no qual você tem que derrotar os inimigos usando bandagens, seringas etc, assim como desviar dos tiros no timing certo.

Ele é curto sim de fato, zerei a primeira vez em 40 minutos e a segunda vez em 35 minutos (obtendo o 100%), mas de graça e criado como forma de caridade, Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt tem uma atmosfera extremamente nostálgica e divertida, o jogo é excelente e de graça, recomendo a todos darem ao menos uma boa conferida.

20361971.review:
Крайне достойный релиз. Вначале, правда, пришлось разобраться в геймплее, но потом, когда втянулся, игрушка доставила массу удовольствия. 
Чем подкупает оная?
– Картинкой. Нет, игра не сверхреалистична, не шокирует сочными яркими цветами, она крайне аскетична  и, как ни парадоксально, этим притягивает. Объясню: современной графикой меня удивить сложно, 8-битные и выше ретро игры немного приелись, зато подобная картинка в духе ZX Spectrum пока что ещё не вызывает неприязни. Конечно, это очень субъективный плюс, я понимаю, но всё же решил отметить оный. Игра в любом случае сделана с душой и в рамках такой графики она выглядит крайне замечательно.
– Музыка. Пожалуй, для меня это главный плюс. Нет, вот так: жирный плюсище! Аудио оформление выполнено шикарно! Пока я играл в Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt, я не переставал постукивать ногой в такт мелодиям. Они написаны замечательно! Пожалуй, если бы в продаже был саундтрек этой игры, то я приобрёл бы его. 
– Игровой процесс. Поначалу будет немного непривычно играть, наверное. Но затем вы вникнете и вас, уверен, будет сложно оторвать. Управление просто донельзя. А система взаимодействия с миром игры более чем удобна. Единственный нюанс, омрачающий процесс прохождения – это движения персонажа, он (а точнее она) словно скользит по льду и порой это немного раздражает. Впрочем, это лишь маленькая досадность и на оную можно закрыть глаза. В целом игра не сложная и без напрягов проходится за час. Разумеется, если вы хотите пройти её на 100%, то понадобится больше времени. 
Пожалуй, на этом и закончу. Игру я от души рекомендую всем любителям ретро! Качайте, бесплатная всё же.

20344476.review:
(Note: I wrote this review somewhere else on the internet shortly after Ludosity first released Princess Remedy in 2014. The new features (controller support, more difficulty modes and options) are nice quality of life additions but as far as content goes it appears to be the same as the version I have sitting on my desktop. This game is still as cute and fun as I remember it to be.)

-

Princess Remedy is one of the 6 or so games to come out of the recent Games Against Ebola game jam. The other games haven't been released to the public but fortunately for you and I, the fine folks at Ludosity have released it for free!

The game puts you in the role of the titular Princess Remedy, who has been sent on a mission from her home planet of Saturn to heal all the sick people in Hurtland! The various peoples of Hurtland have many ailments, ranging from sick burns to an actual lack of a body. What I'm getting at is that it's a Ludosity game. It's got their trademark playful writing and has some cameos from characters from a couple of their other games too.

Despite being made in less than 4 days the game has some solid gameplay. When you heal people you go inside their bodies(?) and blast their troubles away with your Saturnian healing magic. You're constantly shooting, so you only need to focus on dodging enemies and their bullets. After you heal someone you get a heart, which increases your max health in healing mode and are also used to unlock doors to other areas. There are also other upgrades you can find in the overworld that increase your damage, the number of shots you shoot, health regen and the amount of flasks (bombs) you can carry.

Oh, and at the end of the game you are given the option to literally marry anyone you've healed over the course of the game. It comes straight out of left-field but it's still a neat addition since there are about 30+ characters to choose from. That's like 30 different endings! I love everything about this game and I kinda wish they would expand this game into something longer. I'm 1000% sure they probably won't but I can dream can't I?

20327462.review:
TLDR: "I am suffering from a severe case of death." 10/10 Like undertale but with less talking and more healing.

In all seriousness I love this game and knew it was coming before all of you. How?

I played the 48 Hour jam version (which i believe didn't have the difficulty settings), and immediately, with my 5 hours in game maker pro went "I'm going to port this."
Welp, i'm sorry whoever was in charge that day, because i, of course, never came through (because porting from GM7, to GMS is the hardest thing you will ever do.) He did end up telling me they were thinking about putting it on Steam themselves, though.

In case you are wondering, i got to after the intro cutscene, before the game refused to work.

Anyway, review time:
Story: You play as princess remedy, helping cure diseases so you can become queen, and to find a suitable prince. Armed with magic bandaids and [strike] Death Grenades [/strike] healing flasks, you must heal everyone in the World of Hurt. Very simple plot, but it does the job.

Gameplay:  This is an Action RPG/Cute em up with no leveling or random encounters. Instead, you walk into the villiage or special area (Marked by a discolorment in the terrain), talk to people, animals, or random out of place stuff like flowers, and fight thier illnesses. after that, you get a permanent powerup. you can also find these permanent powerups in chests. The stat you need to progress is HP, as that opens gates to new areas. all fights are enjoyable with a fair enemy variety that never feels cheap, and if you die no loading screens or nothing, so you can just talk to the person/thing and get right back into the fray!  also, the final, unique boss, [spoiler] Not Kefka[/spoiler], really fits the charm of the game.

Music/Visuals: Do thier job, were intentionally simple so they could make a complete game in 48 hours. Menu music is incredible though.

Cureently thinking about making a youtube playthrough of this game on mastery mode. It's REALLY GOOD, could be seen as up there with Undertale, and is Free. I completed the game 5 times in the 48 hour version, and i'm one to only play a game once.

GET THIS GAME/10.

20325312.review: I was surprised that a free game could be this good and charming. This is a great game that reminds me of the days of old MSX games or early home computer games. Its got great music, plenty of secrets, and multiple endings. The multiple endings were a nice little reward for beating the game. The gameplay is simple but challenging and the challenge picks up as you progress. There is also a pretty epic last boss fight. Just an all around enjoyable game that anybody can enjoy, and it costs you $0. I hope for a fleshed out sequel, I'd pay for that. Hell I would of thrown a buck or two for this game too.

20316826.review: One of the best 'free' games on steam. It was a little hard for me to get used to the buttons at first, since every button was just about the action button other than the arrow keys. But once I got the hang of it I really began enjoying it. The story was simple, but it still pulled me in enough to finish it. The gameplay is about an hour long depending on how well you do. The art is cute, it's simple as well, but it has a very 80's aesthetic vibe about it. With the retro colors, and nicely done music....for a game made in 4 days, this is a very well done game. It even had my scratching my head a few times when I couldn't get certain fights and I'd try redoing them. But yes I definitely recommend this game. I know it doesn't really seem like it's gotten much attention, but it definitely deserves a lot more than what it has.

This game is really adorable! This game isn't exactly groundbreaking on any account, it's really all about the aesthetic of the game! It evokes a lot of nostalgia for people who've played 8-bit games in their childhood, and its soundtrack is also very catchy! I really liked the black backgrounds of the game, it gives the game a more unique feel compared to other 8-bit titles, plus the neon colors are much more striking.
In the game, you are a girl from Saturn named Princess Remedy, and it is up to you to run around the world and heal those around you who are hurt. It has a happy atmosphere as you get to heal everyone in a bullet hell fashion. The game can be completed in about an hour and it can actually be challenging at points. This adds to a bit of replayability as there are a couple of difficulties to choose from.
All in all, I think its a neat little game and a fun way to pass an hour.

38953271.review:
Принцесса Лекарство была послана с Сатурна, дабы излечить Больные Земли (Hurtland), но чудо в том, что она излечит твое сердечко, многострадальный геймер.
Я, в начале игры, столкнулся с непониманием: не понимал что существует 2 версии игры (от первой версии remedy_gm5  - вытекали глаза), не понимал почему подключение X-BOX геймпада приводило к краху игры (и все еще не пойму), не понимал зачем используют только одну кнопку для всех действий (от чего вместо бега зачастую уходил в меню).
Однако, все эти недочеты исчезают в легком и ненавязчивом юморе, в казалось бы простом геймплее, но раскрывающимся на высоких уровнях сложности, в очаровывающем чиптюне и 8-bit'ной графике.
Игра является прекрасным примером, как из минимума можно выжать максимум. Неигрового персонажа в игре можно описать тремя словами, но зачастую эти неприметные NPC оставляют улыбку на лице и запоминаются своим странным поведением или отсылкой на культуру, или на видеоигровых персонажей (Ittle Dew, Fallout 2 ...), или возможностью заключить с ними брачный союз.
А главное : теплые чувства и непередаваемое ощущение целостности игры и себя, после знакомства с ней.

40924746.review:
It's an alright game I guess.

There are a few problems I noticed. It seems to have been modeled after a Game Boy Color game but instead of having a d-pad, start, select, b, and a, it has the controls of like it is under the restrictions of an Atari 2600 controller. If it were made for that system, I can understand that classic control scheme, but this is Game Boy Color! Why is this a problem you ask? That one button does everything in game. I know how games like this are supposed to operate on a Game Boy Color. I've played Pokemon Generation II games. To run, you have to be walking and press the "action" button. Press it before, and it brings up the menu. To access the menu, you can't be directly facing anything in front of you. You have to make an effort to walk away. The menu is broken too. Selecting options in the menu is fine but if you want to exit, you have to highlight stats and then press "action". Why couldn't the control scheme be as follows:

[h1]Overworld[/h1]
D-pad: Move Princess Remedy and navigate menus
Start: Menu show/hide
B: Running/progressing dialog tree/navigate menu backwards
A: Talk to NPC/progressing dialog tree/navigate menu forwards

[h1]Fighting[/h1]
D-pad: Move Princess Remedy
Start: Pause
B: Flask
A: Attack

I am using a gamepad, so I think I can handle it vs. using a keyboard.

For whatever reason, the game takes 30 seconds to load. This is a simple game that shouldn't take that long. Was this game created in Game Maker? Oh, and the resolution of a Game Boy Color is 160x144, but the game is running in 160x140. Enlarging the screen is blurry and the Steam overlay is broken (screen only shows the game screen and not what is pictured):
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails?id=1336211010

40890331.review:
A surprise of a little sprite shooter. Simple art and gameplay yet not ugly or boring. Insanely easy controls. Very enjoyable background music. Overall a great asthetic inspired by retro arcade shooters. Had a lot of fun playing it on normal mode and might try a run through on the highest difficulty out of morbid curiosity. For what it is, it packs a punch with how challenging and fast paced it is. Some nice surprises as well. I think my only complaint is that it is too short. I could have played this for a much longer period of time before getting bored. 

I would say something about the story but it is obvious that it is just an excuse for the game to exist. Though I will say I did find the idea that you are healing people through killing these enemies in a casual bullet hell to be a very amusing aspect. Maybe I will try the sequel and hopefully that will have more content for this rather addictive set up.

Overall I give it a 7 out of 10. Had it been somewhat longer, easily would have been 8 out of 10.

40570457.review:
[i]Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt[/i] e' un gioco Action-RPG con elementi Bullet-Hell sviluppato in soli 4 giorni da Ludosity (conosciuti specialmente per la Saga di Ittle Dew) durante una gamejam di beneficenza trattenuta nel 2014 

Nel gioco impersoni Remedy, una principessa che, subito dopo aver finito gli studi di medicina, si deve avventurare nel mondo di Hurtland con l'obbiettivo di salvare il principe e i suoi sudditi da diverse malattie.

Il gioco e' piuttosto semplice: per curare una persona malata devi semplicemente parlarci, che fara' scattare un minigioco dove dovrai sparare alle malattie ed evitare i loro colpi.
Una cosa un po' frustrante e' che spari nella stessa direzione di dove guardi, il che lo rende in un certo senso complesso.
Ma questo dettagio si puo' perdonare col fatto che il gioco si ispira ai vecchi giochi Famicon/Nes.

I dialoghi sono molto divertenti, la musica 8-bit ben fatta.

I nemici non sono molto difficili, la stessa cosa vale per il boss finale, ma se volete c'e' la possibilita' di scegliere la difficolta' del gioco prima di creare un nuovo salvataggio (personalmente ho giocato solo in modalita' normale, in futuro forse lo provero' in modalita' piu' difficili)

Il gioco nella difficolta' base dura meno di un'ora, un'ora se lo vuoi completare al 100%
Ovviamente questo cambiera' a seconda della difficolta'

Il gioco e' completamente GRATIS, ma se volete esiste un sequel a 2.99€

[b]7/10[/b]

40317026.review:
(Before you start reading, just want to mention that I did a video version of this review on my Youtube channel. Feel free to check it out if you prefer that: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fq0xsC4pNrE )

I was sitting at home, pretty upset, in dire need of an uplift. I decided that it would be a good time to get a new videogame to cheer me up. However, it was pretty late at night, and I was already in the middle of a few games, so I didn’t want to start something that would take too long. That’s when I found this Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt.

The game is pretty small in scope. The graphics, for example, are very simple. The pixel art is very uncomplicated, each character is usually only one color, and almost the entire game takes place against a black backdrop. However simple, the graphics get the job done, and they are honestly quite charming. Each playthrough of Princess Remedy is only slightly more than an hour long, but that doesn’t prevent it from being an amazing experience that jam-packs every minute with kilotons of fun.

As the game begins, Princess Remedy has just graduated from healing school. Recently, Remedy’s friend Frallan left to go heal Prince Hingst, but she never returned. Now, Remedy must descend into Hurtland and build her skill in order to heal Prince Hingst and find Frallan.

After this brief exposition, Remedy descends into Hurtland. On her journey, she travels through many places, kindly helping anyone who is in need. In Princess Remedy, the overworld has multiple different sections. Each section contains multiple areas that you can explore and talk to people in. Thanks to the funny dialog and the great music, exploring the world is a constant delight. 

The other pillar of the game is the combat. If you talk to someone who needs to be healed, they will first spout a witty 1-liner describing their affliction. Then, you will go to another screen for the combat. After you win, the character visibly looks much happier, and they say another line of dialogue about how they’re healed. It’s often funny, because their problem is not solved in the way you would expect. For example, one character complains about stinking a little. Then, after you heal him, he will be happy, because now he stinks a lot! 

Combat exists as a top-down, 2D shooter, in which both you and the enemies walk on a 2d grid. You walk around to avoid enemies, but your attacks are always shooting in the way you are walking. You also have a powerful bomb projectile that in the beginning, you can use once per fight.

Since fights are plentiful but very short, Princess Remedy makes a wise decision for the music to remain consistent from exploration to fights. This adds to the carefree happiness of the game, really allowing you to sink in to its vibes. Even if you lose, you simply have to talk to the character again to retry, and the music keeps on going.

As the game progresses, more and more enemies will appear in each fight, making it more difficult. New enemies are also gradually introduced throughout. Furthermore, a lot of the variety comes from the different layouts of the enemies and barriers. There is always different strategy each time, thinking about which way to go first, what enemies to prioritize, and when to use your bombs. It’s a great feeling when you try and try a bunch of times until you finally figure out a way to win the fight.

In addition to the enemies, there are breakable barriers, which add even more strategy. Sometimes you need to break them in order to shoot an enemy, but sometimes that will also give enemies access to you. Sometimes, you decide when to break them, but sometimes, you might break them by accident, and that’s when all hell breaks loose.

The combat may seem simple, but it’s very joyful, and actually, the thought involved adds a lot of depth. Also, your health, power, multi, regen, and flasks are constantly getting better. Your health, pretty self explanatory, is the amount of damage you can take. Your power is the amount of damage each of your shots does. Your multi is how many shots you shoot at once. Your regen is how quickly your health refills, and finally, your flasks are the amount of flasks, or bombs as I call them, you can use per fight.

The way you improve your stats is through exploring. When exploring the various areas of the game, you will find treasure chests lying about. Some of them are out in the open, some are tucked away, and for some of them, you have to find a hole in the walls or other scenery that you can walk through. Each part of the environment that you can walk through has a little mark on it, forcing you to keep your eyes peeled. Each chest will power up one of your stats. The only things I don’t like about this, is why there are treasure chests randomly lying about in the middle of towns. This doesn’t really make any sense. In addition to improving your stats in this way, you will also get an extra unit of health every time you successfully win a fight.

Speaking of bad things, I only have a few minor complaints with this game. It is pretty disappointing that there are no boss fights in the game, with the exception of the final boss, which is fantastic by the way. Also, for whatever reason, there is always a little black square under Remedy, even when the background is not black. I also hate the characters that, particularly in the beginning, tell you what button to press, which makes no sense in the game’s world.

Later areas in the game are blocked by gates. To progress, you need a certain amount of hearts. Princess Remedy very occasionally became mildly frustrating when I just needed one or two more hearts, but I could not for the life of me find any more chests or anyone else to heal, so I had to search through the whole game up until that point just to find the one heart that I missed. I think it would’ve been better if there was a little leighway regarding the gates: For example, if there were 40 hearts available up until that point, you should only need like 37 to pass. 

Another minor issue arises with pausing. For some reason, instead of using a seperate button, you pause with the same button that you interact with the environment with. If someone is in front of you and you press the button, you talk to them. If not, you pause. This is confusing design that resulted in me pausing accidentally every once in a while. It’s also confusing at first how you are supposed to leave the pause screen, though this is only a minor issue. Finally, I did have a minor issue with the plot near the end, but I’m not going to comment on it for the sake of spoilers.

Despite being only about an hour long, Princess Remedy has a fair amount of replayability. The game has 3 difficulties: normal, hard, and expert. In most games, it often isn’t worth it to play again on another difficulty, but in this game, on higher difficulties, the enemy layouts are completely different. As a result, the combat is all new on the second and third time around. Playing normal, hard, and expert consecutively provides a great difficulty curve. In total, I spent a little over 4 hours on my first 3 playthroughs, including my expert playthrough in which I want for 101% completion.

Princess Remedy is a short, compact game, but I loved nearly every second. The exploration is fun, the combat is exciting, the writing is funny, and the music is great too. On top of that, the game is completely free. That’s right: it costs zero dollars, and due to the minimal graphics, I’d bet you can play it on pretty much any modern laptop or computer. With its short length and its nonexistent price on Steam, it has one of the lowest barriers of entry of any game. Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt is a wonderful game, and I highly recommend it. For more reviews, feel free to check out my Youtube channel, Youngster Skaymore.

39881513.review:
If you thirst for bullet hell games but are not willing to spending money, this is a decent game. However, compared to a bullet hell game that I would recommend, the enemies are too close to react, and the control is also too crude for precision control (I cannot count how many times I died due to having the character's finger stuck on a rock). I think the game acknowledges this and tries to remediate by introducing HP and infinite retries (vs. normal one-shot-death and finite lives), but I don't think it's enough to make up for it.

You could argue that maybe this game isn't trying to be bullet hell. In that case, go for it. I just feel it has too much luck factor for my taste.

39800299.review:
I just completed this game 100% and here's what I thought of it.

-=PROS=-
- Fun and addicting gameplay. This kind of bite-sized, top-down shooting game is always a delight to play.
- Cute art style. I really like the old computer styled graphics.
- Very funny. Almost every NPC has something funny to say. The highlight for me was that you can marry anyone, even an Apathetic Frog, what's not to like?
- Multiple control schemes. You can use plenty of buttons to fire your flasks, and even walk with WASD if you want.
- Free. You can't go wrong with free.

-=CONS=-
- Short length. I know I probably shouldn't be complaining about the length of a free game, but it's a bit dissapointing that it took me only an hour to complete it. Well, at least there's a sequel.
- Lack of difficulty. Don't get me wrong, it gets pretty tough later on, but most of the encounters are way too easy, or at least they were for me.
- Lack of a strafe button. I know that it's trying to stay simple, and in the end it wasn't THAT bad, but it was kind of annoying not being able to move around and hold the direction I was firing in.
- This game and it's sequel are on Steam, but Iji isn't. Daniel Remar, if you're reading this, PLEASE get Iji on Steam! It's such a good game and more people need to play it!

-=IN CONCLUSION=-
Love it! Absolutely love it! If you like top-down action games and have a sense of humor, you'll have a great time with this.
